metadata.questionText: \text{Line } L_1 \text{ has equation } y = 4x + 1. \\[0.5em]\text{ What is the gradient of a line perpendicular to } L_1?
metadata.explanation: Perpendicular lines have gradients that multiply to -1. If m₁ = 4, then m₂ = -1/4. This gives m₁ × m₂ = 4 × (-1/4) = -1.
